entry.title: UV Light Unveils the Extraterrestrial Luminescence of the American West in Cody Cobbâ€™s Photos
entry.summary: In his ongoing Spectral series, Las Vegas-based photographer Cody Cobb projects an ultraviolet light source across desert shrubs and secluded, rocky coves, unveiling an invisible spectrum of blues and oranges. Lichens, fallen leaves, and the bacteria growing from lava tubes become radiant lifeforms and transform locations in Washington, Utah, California, and New Mexico into otherworldly landscapes. Focused on organic matter like mineral deposits and plants, Cobbâ€™s photos expose what he describes as a â€œparallel world,â€ where the UV light allows an extraterrestrial eeriness to emerge. More

entry.title: Bewildering Inconveniences Trap Subjects in Uncomfortable Scenarios in Ben Zankâ€™s Surreal Photography
entry.summary: The ordinary collides with the bizarre in Ben Zankâ€™s photography. Set on the street, on construction sites, or in grassy fields, his surreal images capture subjects in unequivocally inconvenient positions: A businessman finds himself trapped under a concrete block, a wood pile stacks atop one figure, and another precariously grasps the edge of a sinkhole. Often hiding their faces behind barriers or through a distinctly avoidant turn of the head, Zank anonymizes his subjects, making their awkward predicaments appear all the more inevitable and bound to happen to unassuming passersby. More

entry.title: In Roberto de la Torreâ€™s Documentary Photos, Yearly Masking Rituals Celebrate the Change of the Seasons
entry.summary: In regions throughout Europe, ancient religions often welcomed solstices and equinoxes by crafting elaborate garments that evoked different points in the agricultural cycle. Bulky suits of fur and hide might reference the slow movements of winterâ€™s dormancy, while the straw dresses associated with the TafarrÃ³n festival ask for fertility in the coming year. More vibrant iterations with patterns and towering headdresses are known as boteiros, or the centuries-old garments associated with the entroido of the Viana do Bollo region in Spain. More

entry.title: In â€˜Colonial Ruptures,â€™ Artist Sharif Bey Defies the Constraints of Time through Fragmented Figures
entry.summary: Artist Sharif Bey centers his practice around recontextualizing, a process he undertakes by fracturing long-held perspectives through fragments. His figurative sculptures unify disparate materials and broad cultural references across generations and erasâ€”his works are notably undatedâ€”drawing on both the aesthetics of West-Central Africa, particularly the spiritual protectors known as nkisi, and the industrial histories of his family and current city of Syracuse. Largely crafted around bits of his own ceramic vessels, Beyâ€™s works are on view at Torontoâ€™s Gardiner Museum in a solo exhibition titled Colonial Ruptures, which questions the inherent value and power of objects, particularly as theyâ€™re stripped from their original cultures through colonial violence and structural racism. More

entry.title: Animator Anna Samo Scripts a Love Letter to Artists in Her Short Film â€˜Conversations With a Whaleâ€™
entry.summary: Artists know this story well: an opportunity opens for an exhibition or a festival and in goes the application, but all that comes back is a rejection letter. While one or two letters of this kind might be easy to dismiss, they weigh heavily on oneâ€™s mind if they start to pile up. Animator Anna Samo taps into the unique emotional and mental fatigue endured by creatives who keep hitting roadblocks. In her stop-motion film â€œConversations with a Whale,â€ she turns the prospect of a â€œnoâ€ into a fresh perspective on growth. More

entry.title: Olafur Eliasson Designs a Conical Structure with 832 Vibrant Glass Panels That Reflect Sonomaâ€™s Weather
entry.summary: A bold, conical structure stands on The Donum Estate in Sonoma Valley, casting a vibrant kaleidoscope of 24 colors underneath its canopy. The work of Studio Other Spacesâ€”artist Olafur Eliasson (previously) and architect Sebastian Behmann co-founded the Berlin-based project in 2014â€” â€œVertical Panorama Pavilionâ€ is â€œinspired by the history of circular calendars,â€ containing 832 glass pieces arranged around an oculus opening to the north. Drawing on the microclimate of the vineyard, the studio constructed the mosaic of translucent and transparent panels using meteorological measurements of solar radiance, wind intensity, temperature, and humidity. More

entry.title: The First Video of an Extremely Rare Jellyfish Captures Its Striped Tentacles and Spotted, Pulsing Body
entry.summary: There have been only two documented sightings of the elusive Chirodectes maculatus, a large, soccer ball-sized jellyfish with distinct spotted markings, the second of which was captured late last year by divers from Scuba Kavieng. In what is believed to be the first recording, the video shows the extremely rare animal, which has four clusters of striped tentacles, rings covering its body, and a pulsing patch of red on its bell thatâ€™s likely a digestive cavity, as it swims near the coast of Papua New Guinea. More
